alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN PASSAIC AND SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bloomingdale, or near West Milford, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... West Milford around 640 PM EDT. Ringwood around 650 PM EDT. Greenwood Lake around 705 PM EDT. Monroe and Harriman around 715 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Tuxedo Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
